sub_title: Inventory Analyst | International Business Graduate | Crypto fanatic
summary:
A well-presented, dynamic and self-motivated individual with  experience in the hospitality and supply chain industries,  graduated studying MSc in International Business Management from the University of Bristol, UK. I have a strong ability to work both independently and within a team in a changing and multitasking environment with numerous and competing deadlines. 

I'm a huge crypto fanatic and an avid reader of world politics. 

Currently working as an Inventory Analyst for World's largest Automated Warehouse of one of the Big 4 tech companies in the World.

school.name: Yashodham High school and Junior college

awards.title: Bristol Plus Award
awards.description:
•	University of Bristol Career Service imparted this award to a total of 700 of 23,000 students for demonstrating excellent employability skills based on work experience and attendance of employee-led Intensive skills workshop.
•	Completed Bristol Future’s online course ‘Innovation & Enterprise’- insight into turning ideas into reality. I also explored on how to structure and solve problems, generate and evaluate ideas, and exercise influence.

certifications.name: Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification
Innovation and Enterprise(University of Bristol)

company.name: Future Learning - Learning & Knowledge Development Arm of Future Group

profile_positions.description:
● Managing inventory stock, performing inventory analysis, and supervising day-to-day inventory operations at
the client's warehouses. The client in this case was Google Cloud Logistics.
● Focusing on ensuring that any operational issues impacting customer consignments are proactively
addressed and a culture of continuous improvement is implemented within the Inventory team.
● Physically perform inventory counts and reconcile results with Inventory records.
● Using the JDA and SAP ERP system to perform inventory adjustments, create sales orders, extract
Inventory stock data.
● Extracting and analyzing various daily & weekly Inventory trends from Google datastudio dashboards
and presenting them during daily ops meetings.
● Handing Internal and external reporting - monitoring service-level agreements, KPI’s, quality metrics, count
efficiency, monthly and quarterly review to ensure that best in class performance in terms of cost and service
is achieved.
● Responsible for maintaining Master data and performing system and stock reconciliation.
● Recognizing the requirement for & supporting the implementation of corrective/preventive action plans.
● Owning and ensuring all processes and operational guidelines which impact customer’s shipments and
delivery performances are identified and maintained as per the agreed service-level agreements.
● Facilitate and perform Inventory audits in collaboration with the customer.
● Analyzing KPI’s and root causes of inventory discrepancies and identifying risks and opportunities that
affect stock accuracy including liaising with customer support team.
profile_positions.title: Inventory Analyst

profile_positions.description:
- Acting as a liaison between the Operations, Planners, Quality and the Inventory team, in order to manage day-to-day operations on the floor.
- Handling complex queries and deviations concerning air, sea and road freights.
- Owning and ensuring all processes, system guidelines and other issues which impact customer’s shipments and delivery performances are identified and resolved as per the agreed Service Level Agreements. 
- Being the voice of the customer, actioning all customer grievances received, ensuring that detailed and accurate reports are provided to the higher management for corrective actions.
- Focusing on ensuring that any operational issues impacting customer consignments  are proactively addressed and reported to the relevant teams. 
- Assisting the RCCA lead with root cause analysis investigations.
profile_positions.title: Business Support Specialist

profile_positions.description:
•	Deputised for shift manager and organized junior staff responsibilities.
•	Dealt with high-volume customers, skillfully anticipated and addressed guests’ service needs. 
•	Worked as a receptionist and carried out daily tasks which included, dealing with reservations, 
        answering emails, and checking in and out of guests.
•	Managed the flow of products and stocks through a warehouse. 
•	Followed set procedures and pulled 1.000+ supply orders daily in a structured manner and with a sense of urgency in a large, fast-paced warehouse environment.
•	Performed data entry tasks and filled stock reports in the SAP system.
•	Assisted the supply chain manager in the Order to Customer process and ensured efficient delivery of products to the customers. 
•	Ensured inventory has been processed, organized, and sorted. 
•	Co-ordinated with the shipping and sales department on service-related issues and executed return process in case of discrepancies. 
•	Pro-actively filled various forms, such as the Goods Received Note, Material Transfer Form, and Inventory sheet in the SAP system.
profile_positions.title: Junior Logistics Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for soliciting donations from Bristol graduates to help Bristol retain its reputation of teaching and research by supporting current students and pioneering research.
•	Worked as a part of a dedicated and professional team & raised more than £125,000 and enhanced my communication and negotiation skills. 
•	Assisted the Office Manager by providing additional support in dealing with invoices, filing documents, and managing administrative tasks before the start of each shift.
•	Acted as a liaison between the office and the team in the resolution of day-to-day administrative and operational issues.
•	Connected with alumni from all over the UK and Europe on service-related questions and offered them suitable solutions.
•	Collected and entered all client-related data in the Oracle system and maintained accurate records of valuable information.
profile_positions.title: Sales and Fundraising Associate

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed 25 employees as a Shift Supervisor; responsible for smooth functioning of set processes, 
        client interactions, addressing problems and troubleshooting, inventory checks and managing 
        supplies.
•	Produced various reports and dashboards using MS Excel- Formulas, Vlookup & Pivot table, and presented them to the Store Manager for monthly revenue analysis. 
•	Ensured compliance with all health, safety and other statutory laws and regulations.
•	Supervised and trained more than 15 junior staff to achieve superior standards of professional code and hospitality. Trained them to become successful baristas and customer service representatives. 
•	Led a team of ten for coffee seminars to spread Starbucks coffee culture and to drive in more 
        sales.
•	Undertook business administrative tasks such as data entry, handling the Purchase orders, invoices, stock, and delivery control using the SAP ERP system 
•	Analysed KPIs for new beverage promotions and designed promotional events for new product launches.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Store Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Among top 20 candidates selected for internship from 6 different colleges.
•	Worked across 4 departments- Kitchen, Housekeeping, Front office and Food & beverage to gain 
        understanding of hotel operations.
•	Assumed responsibilities of Concierge, Garde Manger and Inventory Supervisor.
•	Managed guest orders and internal requirements including health, safety and fire checks
profile_positions.title: Industrial release trainee

volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Volunteered as a mentor during extra-curricular sport-based activity days for 8-11 years old and helped them to build their confidence and self-esteem top 20 candidates selected for internship from 6 different colleges.
•	Acted as a pastoral support to young children.
•	Volunteered as a tutor to young people, which aimed to tackle educational disadvantage in schools with high-level of socio-economic deprivation and provided extra support to pupils.
•	Developed behaviour management skills by mentoring under-privilege students with different cultural backgrounds.
•	Became more adaptable to different work environment and improved time management skills by making students understand a particular concept in a given time frame.
